name: Project
title: Gcloud
Search
Project
description:
Project

Projects are top-level containers in Google Cloud Platform. They store information about billing and authorized users, and they control access to Google Cloud Search resources. Each project has a friendly name and a unique ID. Projects can be created only in the Google Developers Console. See Gcloud#search.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
search = gcloud.search
index = search.index "books"

require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new "my-project", "/path/to/keyfile.json"
search = gcloud.search

search.project #=> "my-project"

require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
search = gcloud.search

index = search.index "books"
index.index_id #=> "books"

examples.caption: A new index can be created with index_id and skip_lookup:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
search = gcloud.search

index = search.index "more-books"
index #=> nil
index = search.index "more-books", skip_lookup: true
index.index_id #=> "more-books"

params.name: skip_lookup
params.description: Optionally create an Index object without verifying the index resource exists on the Search service. Documents saved on this object will create the index resource if the resource does not yet exist. Default is false.

returns.description: nil if the index does not exist

methods.name: indexes
title: Gcloud
Search
Project#indexes
methods.description: Retrieves the list of indexes belonging to the project.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
search = gcloud.search

indexes = search.indexes
indexes.each do |index|
  puts index.index_id
end

examples.caption: Using pagination: (See Gcloud::Search::Index::List)
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
search = gcloud.search

indexes = search.indexes
loop do
  indexes.each do |index|
    puts index.index_id
  end
  break unless indexes.next?
  indexes = indexes.next
end

params.name: prefix
params.description:
The prefix of the index name. It is used to list
all indexes with names that have this prefix.

params.name: token
params.description:
A previously-returned page token representing part
of the larger set of results to view.

params.name: max
params.description: Maximum number of indexes to return. The default is 100.
